Package de.oth.blocklib.renderer.fbo

Class Framebuffer

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.renderer.fbo.Framebuffer
Direct Known Subclasses:
GBuffer, HeightMap, ShadowMap
public abstract class Framebuffer
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract base class for all texture-based framebuffers
Author:
Tobias Werner SoSe18

  • Constructor Details

    • Framebuffer

      public Framebuffer​(int attachments)
      Constructs a new Framebuffer with a given number of texture attachments
      Parameters:
      attachments - number of attachment textures to create

  • Method Details

    • attachDepthBuffer

      protected int attachDepthBuffer​(int width, int height)
      Attaches a depth buffer to this FBO
      Parameters:
      width - width of the depth buffer
      height - height of the depth buffer
      Returns:
      texture ID of the used texture

    • attachColorBuffer

      protected int attachColorBuffer​(int colorIndex, int format, int width, int height)
      Attaches a color buffer to this FBO
      Parameters:
      colorIndex - Index of the color attachment to use for this texture
      format - internal OpenGL texture format to use
      width - width of the texture
      height - height of the texture
      Returns:
      texture ID of the used texture

    • enableDrawBuffers

      protected void enableDrawBuffers​(int count)
      Enables the attached color buffers to be drawn into. Call after all color buffers are attached.
      Parameters:
      count - number of attached color buffers
      See Also:
      attachColorBuffer(int, int, int, int)

    • bindFBO

      public void bindFBO()
      Binds this FBO and pushes the current FBO on the stack.

    • getTextureIDs

      public int[] getTextureIDs()

    • clear

      public abstract void clear()
      Clears every Buffer in this FBO

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()

    • unbindFBO

      public void unbindFBO()
      Unbinds this FBO, and binds the last used FBO instead.
